text: Robert E. Rose (born October 7, 1939) is an American politician. A Democrat, he was the 26th Lieutenant Governor of Nevada from 1975 to 1979 and was the Democratic nominee for Governor of Nevada in 1978. In 1986, Rose was appointed to the Eighth Judicial District Court. He was elected three times to the Nevada Supreme Court serving from 1989 to 2007. Raised in Livingston, New Jersey, Rose graduated from Livingston High School in 1957, Juniata College in 1963 and New York University School of Law in 1964. He was president of the first graduating class at Livingston High School and was inducted into the school's hall of fame in 1994."Three Alumni to be Inducted into LHS Hall of Fame", West Essex Tribune, June 2, 1994. Accessed August 5, 2019. "Robert E. Rose, the president of the first graduating class of LHS in 1957, was graduated from Juniata College in 1963 and earned his law degree from New York University in 1964." ==References== ==External links== * Profile from JAMS Foundation Category:Living people Category:District attorneys in Nevada Category:Juniata College alumni Category:Lieutenant Governors of Nevada Category:Livingston High School (New Jersey) alumni Category:New York University School of Law alumni Category:Justices of the Nevada Supreme Court Category:1939 births Category:Candidates in the 1978 United States elections Category:20th-century American politicians Category:People from Livingston, New Jersey Category:People from Orange, New Jersey Category:Nevada Democrats Category:Chief Justices of the Nevada Supreme Court
title: Robert E. Rose
